intro: Lens lens, commonly known as the common lentil, is an annual legume belonging to the Fabaceae family. It is characterized by its lens-shaped seeds that are typically yellow, green, red, or brown in color. The plant grows to a height of about 30–60 cm and produces small, pea-like flowers that bloom in clusters. Its trifoliate leaves are alternate and have a heart-shaped leaflet. The plant is known for its ability to fix atmospheric nitrogen, improving soil fertility.
